title._content: [Portrait of Sy Oliver, New York, N.Y., ca. Sept. 1946] (LOC)

description._content: Gottlieb, William P., 1917-, photographer. [Portrait of Sy Oliver, New York, N.Y., ca. Sept. 1946] 1 negative : b&w ; 2 1/4 x 2 1/4 in. Caption from Down Beat: Sam Donahue & Sy Oliver: Here are a pair of guys who started out as hot soloists, turned to arranging and are now leading orchestras. Both are playing "fundamental" swing, with a maximum of rock and a minimum of extreme musical devices, be it be-bop or Dixieland. When Sy recently opened at the Zanzibar, Sam was a block away at the Aquarium. The last week of Sam's engagement, Lionel Hampton was also booked into the Aquarium and the cats were set for the Swing Battle of '46. But the ensuing behind scenes scuffle ended up with Sam playing afternoons, only . . . And the Aquarium ain't open afternoons! Notes: Gottlieb Collection Assignment No. 433 Reference print available in Music Division, Library of Congress. Purchase William P. Gottlieb Forms part of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (Library of Congress). In: The Record Changer, v. 5, no. 11 (Jan. 47, 1947), p. 6. Subjects: Oliver, Sy Jazz musicians--1940-1950. Conductors (Music)--1940-1950. Trumpet players--1940-1950. Format: Portrait photographs--1940-1950. Group portraits--1940-1950. Film negatives--1940-1950. Rights Info: Mr. Gottlieb has dedicated these works to the public domain, but rights of privacy and publicity may apply. lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-copyrig...
